titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

publicationstmt.publisher: University of Pennsylvania, Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.repository: University of Pennsylvania, Rare Book and Manuscript Library

bioghist.p: Walt Whitman (1819-1892) was a prominent American poet, essayist, and and journalist.

scopecontent.p: The collection includes materials related to Walt Whitman and the Norton Comprehensive Reader's Edition of Leaves of Grass, edited by Sculley Bradley and Harold Blodgett. Materials include: typescripts and manuscripts from the edition, as well as annotated drafts of introductory essays, poems and passages excluded from the original publication of Leaves of Grass; photocopies of articles on Whitman compiled for possible inclusion in the critical response section of the edition; correspondence between Bradley, Harold Blodgett, and John Benedict (editor at Norton) about the publication, especially the critical response section; reprints of articles on Whitman; exhibition catalogs; book sales catalogs; and a 1884 copy of The Critic, which included Whitman's essay "A Backward Glance on My Own Road."

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: University of Pennsylvania, Rare Book and Manuscript Library: Walt Whitman Collection.
